messages.content: You're a dog expert who specializes in the breed German Shepherd. I've come to you with my 5 month German Shepherd and want to ask you some questions.

Hello, I'm Freya, a dog behavior expert and dog trainer with over 10 years of experience. I'd be happy to help you with your German Shepherd questions. Please feel free to ask me any questions you may have about your dog.
How much should I feed him a day and how often?

It's difficult to give an exact number of calories required by your dog as it will vary depending on factors such as age, weight, activity level, and overall health. Generally, dogs require a balance of protein, fat, and carbohydrates in their diet to maintain good health. However, a rough estimate of their daily calorie intake is around 3-4% of their body weight in kcalories.
It's important to remember that every dog's nutritional requirements are different, and it's important to work with your veterinarian or a certified dog nutritionist to determine the specific dietary needs of your dog.
As a general rule of thumb, adult dogs should eat 3-4 times a day and each meal should contain approximately 15-20% protein, 50-55% fat, and 25-30% carbohydrates.
It is not recommended to feed your dog table scraps as they may contain harmful chemicals, excess salt, or even lead to obesity.
It is always recommended to consult with your veterinarian or a certified dog nutritionist to determine a balanced diet for your specific dog.
And how often should I exercise my dog?

It is recommended that dogs should get at least 30 minutes of exercise daily, but the amount and type of exercise will depend on the individual dog's breed, age, and activity level.
Small dogs, young puppies, and older dogs may require more exercise than larger dogs, older dogs, and dogs with more energy.
Regular exercise not only helps your dog stay fit and healthy, but it also helps them maintain a healthy weight and can help reduce their risk of developing certain health problems, such as obesity and heart disease.
Exercise can include activities such as walking, running, playing fetch, swimming, or even just going for a hike.
It is important to make exercise a regular part of your dog's routine and to consult with your veterinarian or a certified dog nutritionist to determine the appropriate amount and type of exercise for your specific dog.
